comments.content: que lo use y que sea correcto son 2 cosas diferentes, se debe iniciar con un reset
It could be, but I always use .Init although never before a SetRange

discussion.content:
Item.Reset();
That should be answer for first. Clear any filter before doing filtering on a record variable.

1. Reset()
2. SetRange()
3. SetFilter()
4. IsEmpty() I use this instead of FindSet. FindSet Must have a repeat undtil to modify all the records. If we do not put it with a Repeat Until, it will modify only the first line.
5. ModifyAll()

1. Reset() , if it´s a new variable not necessary, but we don´t know...
2. SetRange()
3. SetFilter()
4. IsEmpty(), we only need to modify all, if Data exist, Not IsEmpty() -> Data exist
5. ModifyAll()
FindSet you can't use without repeat until

It should be: Reset, SetRange, SetFilter, IsEmpty, ModifyAll.
Reset because you don't know any code before that has set Filters.
IsEmpty is actually not necessary. ModifyAll will determine if the field could be updated or not.

Init() is used to create a record (also sets transaction to begin ... you do not want to do it)
IsEmpty() does not return records (it is just for checking the results ... just like count()) and we need to retrieve records for modification ... so here is a list:
1. Reset()
2. SetRange()
3. SetFilter()
4. FindSet()
5. ModifyAll()

comments.content: It can not be findset() because is not operator at front

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are writing a procedure to block all inventory items with numbers that do not start with the letter S.
You need to complete the procedure.
How should you complete the code expressions? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//

choices.C: Define the navigation bar in the area(embedding).
choices.B: Define the navigation menu in the area(processing).
choices.A: Define actions in the area(reporting) before actions in the area(creation).
choices.D: Add a source table on the Role Center page.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Navigation bar
The second-level navigation displays a flat list of links to other pages. The pages targeted by the links will open in the content area of the Role Center.
You define this area with an area(embedding) control in the page code.


area(creation) 
Actions in this control will appear first in the action area, and will display with a plus (+) icon.

area(reporting) 
Actions in this control will appear last in the action area. They display with a default report icon.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/dev-itpro/developer/devenv-designing-role-centers

Selected Answer: C
Answer should be C

Selected Answer: C
Im not sure, but i think the answer is C.

Selected Answer: A
Whencreating a page with the PageType property set to RoleCenter in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, it's essential to organize the functionalities and actions in a manner that enhances user experience and
 efficiency. The best practice is to define actions in the area (reporting) before actions in the area (creation) (A).

questions.question_text:
You create a page with the PageType property set to RoleCenter.
You navigate through the different sections of the page.
You need to add functionalities to the page.
What should you do?

choices.A: Use CreateInStream method from codeunit "Temp Blob".
choices.B: Use CreateInStream method for BLOB field of "TempBlob" table.
choices.C: Use CreateInStream method for File type variable.

discussion.content: It should be A, because File Type is in Online Enviroments not allowed.

Selected Answer: A
By using the CreateInStream method on a Temp Blob, you create an InStream that can then be used with the DownloadFromStream method to send the file data to the client.

questions.question_text:
A company has a Business Central online environment.
You are exporting a file from a client by using the DownloadFromStream method.
You need to create an InStream data type to send the data.
Which solution should you use?
